svcproc.title: CAB AIR SUSPENSION system for 7300 and 7400 crew cab models

warning.para: For safety purposes cab air suspension must be supplied from a pressure protected air supply.

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to Figure 137 for Items in parentheses.

The cab air suspension system for the 7300 and 7400 crew cab models contains two air springs (bags) (Item 4), two shock absorbers (Items 5 and 6), and is controlled by the height control valve (Item 7). The air suspension assembly (Figure 137) needs no lubrication and very little maintenance

The following components - air lines (to air springs) (Item 13 and 15), tee fitting (Item 11), elbow fitting (Item 12), air springs (bags) (Item 4), height control valve (Item 7), shock absorbers (Items 5 and 6) and lateral control rod (Item 3) - should be checked at the time the truck is being serviced. Immediate corrective action should be taken if a malfunction occurs.

note.para: The height control valve (Item 7), air springs (bags) (Item 4) and shock absorbers (Items 5 and 6) are serviceable and can be replaced individually.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, whenever any component is serviced or removed from air system, be sure to set parking brake and/or block vehicle wheels to prevent it from moving while service is being performed.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Height Control Valve

note.para: If there is an attempt to disassemble or adjust fittings on the height control valve (Item 7, Figure 137) , it will void the warranty. Contact the air suspension manufacturer for assistance.

warning.para: For safety purposes raise cab and block it about 1 inch higher than design height between bottom of cab mounting plate and crossmember mounting plate.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 138 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Press and hold release collet (Item 1) in against fitting body and pull air line (supply) (Item 2) from "SUPPLY" port of height control valve (Item 3).
Loosen compression nut (Item 4) and pull air line (to air spring) (Item 5) from elbow fitting (Item 6) in "SUSP" port of height control valve (Item 3).

Remove height control valve linkage (Item 7) from threaded ball pivot (Item 8) by unlatching linkage clip (Item 9) and carefully pry the height control valve linkage socket from threaded ball pivot on height control valve arm (Item 10).

figure.caption: Figure 138. Cab Air Suspension Height Control Valve

calloutgroup.callout1: 4. COMPRESSION NUT (TIGHTEN HAND TIGHT + ONE TURN)
8. THREADED BALL PIVOT, LOCK WASHER, 1/4 AND HEX NUT, 1/4 UNC
11. HEX HEAD BOLT, M6 X 1 X 45
14. DRIVE BEARING NOTCH FOR VALVE ORIENTATION

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 137 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove two hex head bolts and hex lock nuts (Items 16 and 17) and remove height control valve (Item 7) from mounting bracket of cab mounting plate (Item 1).

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab Air Suspension Shock Absorber

warning.para: For safety purposes raise cab and block it about 1 inch higher than design height between bottom of cab mounting plate and crossmember mounting plate.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 137 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove front shock absorber (Item 5) as follows.

step2.para: Remove hex head bolt and hex lock nut (Items 20 and 21) at the top of front shock absorber (Item 5).
Remove hex head bolt and hex lock nut (Items 20 and 21) at the bottom of front shock absorber (Item 5).
Remove front shock absorber (Item 5) from between cab mounting plate (Item 1) and crossmember mounting plate (Item 2).

step1.para: Remove rear shock absorber (Item 6) as follows.

step2.para: Remove hex head bolt and hex lock nut (Items 20 and 21) at the top of rear shock absorber (Item 6).
Remove hex head bolt and hex lock nut (Items 20 and 21) at the bottom of rear shock absorber (Item 6).
Remove rear shock absorber (Item 6) from between cab mounting plate (Item 1) and crossmember mounting plate (Item 2).

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab Air Suspension Air Spring (Bag)

warning.para: For safety purposes raise cab and block it about 1 inch higher than design height between bottom of cab mounting plate and crossmemeber mounting plate.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 137 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove driver side air spring (bag) (Item 4) as follows.

step2.para: Loosen compression nut of elbow fitting (Item 12) and pull air line (to air spring) (Item 15) from elbow fitting at top of driver side air spring (bag) (Item 4).
Unthread elbow fitting (Item 12) from top of driver side air spring (bag) (Item 4).
Using a screwdriver, pry retaining ring (Item 24) from top of driver side air spring (bag) (Item 4).

note.para: Prying the retaining ring from the top of the air spring (bag) will damage it, a new retaining ring will be supplied with the new air spring (Bag).

step2.para: Remove flat head cap screw (Item 23) from the bottom of driver side air spring (bag) (Item 4) under crossmember mounting plate (Item 2).
Compress driver side air spring (bag) (Item 4) and slide it from between cab mounting plate (Item 1) and crossmember mounting plate (Item 2).

step1.para: Remove passenger side air spring (bag) (Item 4) as follows.

step2.para: Loosen compression nut of tee fitting (Item 11) and pull air line (to air spring) (Item 15) from tee fitting at top of passenger side air spring (bag) (Item 4).
Loosen compression nut of tee fitting (Item 11) and pull air line (to air spring) (Item 13) from tee fitting at top of passenger side air spring (bag) (Item 4).
Unthread tee fitting (Item 11) from top of passenger side air spring (bag) (Item 4).
Using a screwdriver, pry retaining ring (Item 24) from top of passenger side air spring (bag) (Item 4).

note.para: Prying the retaining ring from the top of the air spring (bag) will damage it, a new retaining ring will be supplied with the new air spring (Bag).

step2.para: Remove flat head cap screw (Item 23) from the bottom of passenger side air spring (bag) (Item 4) under crossmember mounting plate (Item 2).
Compress passenger side air spring (bag) (Item 4) and slide it from between cab mounting plate (Item 1) and crossmember mounting plate (Item 2).

svcsubproc.title: Remove Lateral Control Rod

warning.para: For safety purposes raise cab and block it about 1 inch higher than design height between bottom of cab mounting plate and crossmemeber mounting plate.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 137 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove lateral control rod (Item 3) as follows.

step2.para: Remove hex head bolt (Item 22) and hex lock nut (Item 21) from mounting bracket of crossmember mounting plate (Item 2) and lateral control rod (Item 3).
Remove hex head bolt (Item 22) and hex lock nut (Item 21) from cab mounting plate (Item 1) and lateral control rod (Item 3) and remove lateral control rod.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Jounce Bumper
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 137 for Items in parentheses.

step2.para: Remove hex head bolt (Item 18) and hex lock nut (Item 19) from jounce bumper (Item 10).
Remove jounce bumper (Item 10) from underneath cab mounting plate (Item 1).
Repeat procedure to remove the other jounce bumper (Item 10) from underneath cab mounting plate (Item 1).
